instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.U7100: What is U7100? U7100 refers to the ISL6259 or ISL9239 charging IC on Macbooks from 2013 to the present.
definitions.Q7180: What is Q7180? Inrush limiter transistor that must be told by the ISL6259 that it is safe to allow charger voltage to pass through to the computer. This needs CHGR_AGATE and CHGR_SGATE to be pulled down in order for it to close and allow voltage through to the system, current sensing failures as well as ISL6259 failures can cause this to happen. .
definitions.CHGR_AMON: What is CHGR_AMON? CHGR_AMON provides DC current sense information to the SMC(System management controller) or T2 chip(on machines where the SMC is integrated into the T2 chip). It comes from the battery charging chip that controls the laptop charger, battery charging, and creation of PPBUS_G3H(ISL6259, ISL9239, or ISL9240 chip depending on the logic board part number and model). This is used for sensors. If a DC current sense sensor is reading off in diagnostics, this is a place to start looking. .

threads.title: [SOLVED] 3787 no PPBUS, burned DC Jack
threads.message:
No corrosion found, though I did find some crusty milk like stuff near ssd connector.  DC jack has obvious carbon scoring.  Replaced, now get amber light but only pulling .2A on 18.5V supply.  Same on 85W genuine known good adapter.  

Found PPDCIN not getting past dual <TRANSISTOR>Q7180</TRANSISTOR>.  AGATE voltage on left side is 15 volts, shouldn't this be brought down by <CHIP>U7100</CHIP>? CSON jumps.

I've never had to do the logic chain stuff on the retina <CHIP>U7100</CHIP> so please pardon if I do anything stupid.  I replaced the <CHIP>U7100</CHIP> and <TRANSISTOR>Q7180</TRANSISTOR> just in case they were fried.

Basic voltages:
3.42 present obv

<CHIP>U7100</CHIP> (no battery)
1. 15.36
2. 16.35
3. 3.9
9. 1.06
12. 3.39
13. 3.26
14. 3.066
15. 0
17. jumps around .500v to .800v or so
19. 5.51 (isnt it supposed to be 5.1?)
20. 5.51
27. jumps between .226 and .336

Resistance 17+18 @ 3.4  //  27+28 @ 21.1

threads.title: [SOLVED] 3787 no PPBUS, burned DC Jack
threads.message:
"9. 1.06"
There is a problem with <SIGNAL>CHGR_AMON</SIGNAL>.
"27+28 @ 21.1"
Did you check it directly between chip pins???

Does it start in SMC bypass mode?

threads.title: [SOLVED] 3787 no PPBUS, burned DC Jack
threads.message:
Thank you. Is AMON generated by the ISL?

I did indeed check directly between chip pins, unpowered.

It does not seem to start in SMC bypass mode.  I keep power button down for 5 sec, plug in, keep holding for another 10 seconds.  Current draw is up .01 from .02 to .03 but no other activity.

threads.title: [SOLVED] 3787 no PPBUS, burned DC Jack
threads.message:
<SIGNAL>CHGR_AMON</SIGNAL> depends by current flowing through <RESISTOR>R7120</RESISTOR>.
If <RESISTOR>R7120</RESISTOR>/21/22 and their traces are good, then change <CHIP>U7100</CHIP>.

threads.title: [SOLVED] 3787 no PPBUS, burned DC Jack
threads.message:
Changed the <CHIP>U7100</CHIP> twice more, finally got ppbus.  So does the GPU though.   I swear I checked every coil to ppbus fuse, maybe missed it.  Good riddance honestly, I have another one with the same specs i've been holding on to, can finally sell it.

Thanks 2.
